channel.title: Comments on: Tolner Diary
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: midnightrabbi
item.dc:creator: midnightrabbi
item.description:
There's good news from the Tolna Rebbe who now has a new Shul This is all in the Merit of Dovid of Tolna the original Tolna Rebbe whose Yahrzeit is today Netsach Sheb'Netsach, may His merit protect and bless us !
Check out the Tolna Rebbe in English so you can hear the truth of the Tzaddick himself http://midnightrabbi1eligoldsmith.wordpress.com/2012/05/02/chanukas-habayis-ldovid-with-the-tolna-rebbe-in-english-too/ <-click here !
item.content:encoded:
There’s good news from the Tolna Rebbe who now has a new Shul This is all in the Merit of Dovid of Tolna the original Tolna Rebbe whose Yahrzeit is today Netsach Sheb’Netsach, may His merit protect and bless us !

Check out the Tolna Rebbe in English so you can hear the truth of the Tzaddick himself http://midnightrabbi1eligoldsmith.wordpress.com/2012/05/02/chanukas-habayis-ldovid-with-the-tolna-rebbe-in-english-too/ <-click here !

item.title: By: Yonatan
item.dc:creator: Yonatan
item.description:
I asked my brother in law who is Ger & a chareidi pundit about them:
He said the following:
...some real juicy stuff there, but my sources in ger tell me that parts of it are unreliable. Either way, reliable or not, it has a lot of fasnciating stuff in it. ... Btw, in case you know the guy that wrote this, none of it is about the Tolna court. All of it was written long before the Tolna rebbe became rebbe. the tolna rebbe is a gerer chossid who was a long-time magid shiur at yeshiva sefas emes. When his grandfather who was the tolna rebbe passed away, he became rebbe. the entire diary is written years before that ... http://shturem.net/index.php?section=news&id=48083
item.content:encoded:
I asked my brother in law who is Ger & a chareidi pundit about them:

He said the following:

…some real juicy stuff there, but my sources in ger tell me that parts of it are unreliable. Either way, reliable or not, it has a lot of fasnciating stuff in it.
…
Btw, in case you know the guy that wrote this, none of it is about the Tolna court. All of it was written long before the Tolna rebbe became rebbe. the tolna rebbe is a gerer chossid who was a long-time magid shiur at yeshiva sefas emes. When his grandfather who was the tolna rebbe passed away, he became rebbe. the entire diary is written years before that
…
http://shturem.net/index.php?section=news&id=48083

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2011/02/05/talner-diary/#comment-2652">Digital Acolyte</a>.
If your goal is protect the honor of the gedolim, then the book is filled with stories that are not positive.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Digital Acolyte.

If your goal is protect the honor of the gedolim, then the book is filled with stories that are not positive.

item.title: By: Digital Acolyte
item.dc:creator: Digital Acolyte
item.description: Re: Rav Mendel Shafran - are the accusations of 'ניבול פה, ליצנות וזלזול באישים רוחנים " true? Or is this shades of Making of a Gadol?
item.content:encoded: Re: Rav Mendel Shafran – are the accusations of ‘ניבול פה, ליצנות וזלזול באישים רוחנים ” true? Or is this shades of Making of a Gadol?

item.title: By: Yitzhak
item.dc:creator: Yitzhak
item.description:
Rav Mendel Shafran against the Diary - he claims, inter alia, that it contains gross inaccuracies, and lists a number:

item.title: By: Sam
item.dc:creator: Sam
item.description: Can you post the Gerer Takanos regarding Onah? There is much misinformation and I would like to find out the truth about them. Also how do they justify being mevatel the mitzvah of Onah ?
item.content:encoded: Can you post the Gerer Takanos regarding Onah? There is much misinformation and I would like to find out the truth about them. Also how do they justify being mevatel the mitzvah of Onah ?

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2011/02/05/talner-diary/#comment-2551">Hirshel Tzig</a>.
I saw that you posted them. Thank you. I am not interested in general Heimishe gossip. I have not read through them. Is there something significant in them? Even though the Tolner document had lots of gossip, I posted it for the insight into current Israeli Hasidus, waiting for one of my Israeli academic friends to write on the Pnei Menachem.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Hirshel Tzig.

I saw that you posted them. Thank you. I am not interested in general Heimishe gossip. I have not read through them. Is there something significant in them? Even though the Tolner document had lots of gossip, I posted it for the insight into current Israeli Hasidus, waiting for one of my Israeli academic friends to write on the Pnei Menachem.

item.title: By: Hirshel Tzig
item.dc:creator: Hirshel Tzig
item.description:
I haven't heard a name yet, but somebody was asked to type up all the handwritten pages and he made the mistake of passing it on to one person who "swore" not to let anybody else see it...
It's a few years worth, so maybe different people did the writing.
item.content:encoded:
I haven’t heard a name yet, but somebody was asked to type up all the handwritten pages and he made the mistake of passing it on to one person who “swore” not to let anybody else see it…

It’s a few years worth, so maybe different people did the writing.

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2011/02/05/talner-diary/#comment-2546">Hirshel Tzig</a>.
Do you have more details on the publisher or author. I am actually more concerned with the editing. Is there more than one hand? Is it more than one volume that has been placed in a single file. As some readers noted to me in emails. The maasehlach and the records of yehidus have different styles.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Hirshel Tzig.

Do you have more details on the publisher or author.
I am actually more concerned with the editing. Is there more than one hand? Is it more than one volume that has been placed in a single file. As some readers noted to me in emails. The maasehlach and the records of yehidus have different styles.

item.title: By: Hirshel Tzig
item.dc:creator: Hirshel Tzig
item.description: The pages were apparently published without permission of the author
item.content:encoded: The pages were apparently published without permission of the author

item.title: By: Michael
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: Oy vey. Such narishkeit from a rav! It would be better not to publish such nonsense: it's great material for people who wish to make fun of the orthodox. On the other hand, it is rather interesting and embarassing to see the superstition and folkways of a rav.
item.content:encoded: Oy vey. Such narishkeit from a rav! It would be better not to publish such nonsense: it’s great material for people who wish to make fun of the orthodox. On the other hand, it is rather interesting and embarassing to see the superstition and folkways of a rav.
